name: SINTEF Ocean AS
goal:
Sintef Ocean AS formerly known as MARINTEK is part of the SINTEF Group. We performs R & D in ocean technology for a global market, primarily in the maritime and oil and gas sectors and ocean energy. Sintef Ocean has around 300 staff, and its main offices and laboratories are in Trondheim. It is an independent, not for profit limited company, majority owned by the SINTEF foundation.

Sintef Ocean comprises of five sections: maritime (shipping, shipbuilding and ship
equipment); offshore oil and gas; new ocean industries including offshore wind; fishing and aqauaculture and the section for minimizing oil spills and poluttion of the oceans. Activities
cover advanced laboratory services and analyses in marine hydrodynamics and construction
technology, marine ICT services, logistics and maintenance technology, in addition to energy and
environmental technology. Laboratory and testing facilities include: ocean basin, towing tank,
cavitation tunnel, marine structure laboratory and an energy & machinery laboratory. We
has more than 60 years of experience in the development of cost-effective, high performance ships
for the Shipping Industry, where model testing constitutes the most important element. In the field
on operational performance, Sintef Ocean offers expertise within performance measurement and
monitoring for the maritime transport segment, and more specifically for ship management, as well
as for the logistics sector in general. Sintef Ocean has large experience both from EU-projects and
National Research project regarding cargo handling, new vessel concept and the supply chain, and
is an active partner in EU research projects, with more than 60 EU-funded research projects since
the 4th Framework Programme.
interests: Climate Action, Communication, Digital economy and society, Energy, Environment, Maritime affairs and fisheries, Research and innovation, Transport
euInitiatives: Sintef Ocean is a independent research institute getting most of its funding from contract research. Horizon 2020 is one of the sources for funding (about 10% of turn-over).  Several Horizon 2020 research projects, e.g. Leanwind, SELIS, SAFEPEC, SHOPERA, Holiship and several others are at any time ongoing. As an independent research institute we are also participating in various policy and strategy related activities, e.g. STRIA (Strategic Transport Research and Innovation Agenda), DTLF (Digital Transport Logistics Forum) and ESSF (European Sustainable Shipping Forum).
